name: vexy-stax-js
description: Browser-based tool for arranging PNG images along Z-axis in 3D space with Three.js

scripts.clean: rm -rf docs/assets coverage .nyc_output test-results playwright-report && echo 'Cleaned: docs/assets, coverage, test-results'
scripts.audit:size: npm run build && du -sh docs/assets/*.js docs/assets/*.css | sort -h
scripts.prepublishOnly: npm run test:unit && npm run build
scripts.help:
echo '
=== Vexy Stax JS - Available Commands ===

Requirements: Node.js >=18.0.0, npm >=9.0.0

Development:
  npm run dev          → Start dev server (http://localhost:5173)
  npm run build        → Build for production (outputs to docs/)
  npm run preview      → Preview production build
  npm run clean        → Remove build artifacts and coverage reports

Testing:
  npm test             → Run all tests (unit + E2E with Playwright)
  npm run test:unit    → Run unit tests only (227 tests, ~650ms)
  npm run test:coverage → Generate coverage reports (html/text/lcov)
  npm run test:coverage:check → Enforce 80/80/75% thresholds (lines/funcs/branches)

Quality:
  npm run audit:deps   → Check for outdated/vulnerable dependencies
  npm run audit:size   → Analyze bundle size breakdown
  npm run prepublishOnly → Pre-publish validation (tests + build, runs automatically)

Documentation:
  npm run help         → Show this help message
'

author: Adam Twardoch <adam+npm@twardoch.com> (https://twardoch.github.io/)
